basics.name: Michael (Micky) Mangrobang
basics.label: Student/Teaching Assistant
basics.summary: A student currently attending University of Hawaii at Manoa studying for a B.S. in Computer Science. Expected to graduate in Spring, 2018.

education.institution: University of Hawaii at Manoa, Honolulu, HI
courses: Introduction to Computer Science I & II

work.company: University of Hawaii at Manoa Information and Computer Sciences Department
work.summary: Undergraduate teaching assistant for ICS 101 (Digital Tools for the Information World), teaching the use of various software including Microsoft Office, SSH and Adobe Dreamweaver
highlights: Conducted 75-minute lab sessions twice a week
Developed full lesson plans including class format and material for each lab session
Handled student grades including grading homework, quizzes and overall course grade

work.company: County of Kauai Finance Department (Information Technology)
work.summary: Interned for the County of Kauai IT Department, handling various technical support issues
highlights: Built and deployed new shipment of computers for county employees that needed an upgrade
Repaired computers that did not need to be upgraded

work.company: University of Hawaii at Manoa Information and Computer Sciences Department
work.summary: Assistant teaching assistant for ICS101 (Digital Tools for the Information World), assisting both the teaching assistant and students
highlights: Supported a lab session twice a week helping the teaching assistant throughout their lesson
Developed a week's worth of lesson plans including class format and material

work.summary: Interned for the County of Kauai Fire Department, managing the Fire Department's database
highlights: Created and digitized new forms using a variety of software

awards.title: Certificate of Achievement - 4th Place
awards.summary: Recieved a Certificate of Achievement for placing in 4th place statewide with my team in the International Collegiate Programming Contest, sponsored by IBM.
